Pro-Kontra Wacana Larangan Cadar ASN, Bupati Aceh Barat Menolak
01 Nov 2019, 19:26 by Denisa Tristianty


Pro-Kontra Wacana Larangan Cadar ASN, Bupati Aceh Barat Menolak

Jakarta, KBRN : Peraturan melarang pemakaian cadar dan celana cingkrang bagi aparatur sipil negara (ASN) masih berupa wacana hingga hari ini. Namun, wacana yang dilontarkan Menteri Agama, Jenderal (Purnawirawan) TNI Fachrul Razi, pada Rabu (30/10), sudah menuai banyak tanggapan dari berbagai kalangan, dan itu termasuk pejabat pemerintah.
Tanggapan positif datang dari Wakil Presiden Ma’ruf Amin. Mantan Ketua Umum Majelis Ulama Indonesia (MUI) ini menyatakan wacana itu hanya bentuk disiplin.
“Pemerintah itu kan, ada aturannya. Ada aturan pakaian seperti apa. Kalau dia tentara perempuan, polisi perempuan, itu harus seperti apa. Kemudian, pegawai negeri seperti apa,” kata Am’ruf di Kantor Wakil Presiden, Jakarta, seperti dilansir Kantor Berita Antara, Jumat (1/11/2019).
Ma’ruf juga menjawab pertanyaan hubungan larangan pemakaian cadar dan menurunkan radikalisme yang sejauh ini masih menjadi perhatian besar pemerintah. Radikalisme, kata dia, sudah menjadi komitmen semua pihak melakukan penangkalan.
“Apakah radikalisme ideologis, atau bisa juga radikalisme separatis. Saya kira itu, memang kalau dibiarkan akan merusak keutuhan bangsa,” tegas dia.
Aceh menolak
Bupati Aceh Barat, Ramli MS menyatakan penolakan terkait wacana larangan penggunaan cadar atau niqab. Khususnya, jika wacana peraturan itu diberlakukan bagi pegawai di instansi pemerintah daerah setempat.
“Penggunaan cadar di kalangan perempuan adalah hak asasi manusia (HAM) Umat Islam yang harus dijunjung tinggi oleh siapapun, dan pihak manapun. Sebaiknya, ditinjau ulang kebijakan larangan pemakaian cadar di instansi pemerintah seperti yang disampaikan oleh Menteri Agama Fachrur Razi,” ungkap Ramli di Meulaboh, Aceh, Jumat (1/11/2019).
Ramli juga mmeberikan saran kepada Menteri Agama Fachrur. Sebab,kata dia Kementerian Agama sangat memerlukan komunikasi dan meminta pendapat dari MUI, ormas Islam seperti PBNU, Muhammadiyah, dan Persatuan Tarbiyah Islamiyah (Perti).
“Sehingga, polemik seperti ini dapat diakhiri dan  diselesaikan secara bijak,”tegas pria yang juga menjabat PCNU Kabupaten Aceh Barat ini.
Perumusan ciri radikal
Guna meminimalisir paham radikal yang banyak salah diartikan selama ini oleh pemerintah dan masyarakat awam, Ramli juga berani menyuarakan  pandangannya. Sebab, pemerintah pusat sudah lama membuat stigma penggunaan cadar pada perempuan Muslim dan celana cingkrang pada pria Muslim sebagai salah satu cara menangkal radikalisme.
“Itu tidak dapat diidentikkan dengan paham radikal. Agar pemahaman radikal tidak menyakiti Umat Islam, Kemenag agar segera merumuskan atau menetapkan ciri-ciri atau kriteria paham radikal. Sehingga, menjadi jelas dan tidak merugikan Umat Islam,” ujar dia yang menyatakan Islam adalah agama rahmatan lil ‘alamin (rahmat bagi semesta).

Pros and Cons of the Discourse on the ASN Veil Ban, West Aceh Regent Rejects
Nov 01 2019, 19:26 by Denisa Tristianty


Pros and Cons of the Discourse on the ASN Veil Ban, West Aceh Regent Rejects

Jakarta, KBRN: Regulations prohibiting the use of veils and pants for state civil servants (ASN) are still in the form of discourse to this day. However, the discourse put forward by the Minister of Religion, General (Retired) TNI Fachrul Razi, on Wednesday (30/10), has drawn a lot of responses from various circles, and that includes government officials.
Positive responses came from Vice President Ma'ruf Amin. The former Chair of the Indonesian Ulema Council (MUI) stated that the discourse was only a form of discipline.
"The government, there are rules. What are the clothing rules. If she is a female soldier, a female police officer, what should she be like? Then, what kind of civil servants, "said Am'ruf in the Office of the Vice President, Jakarta, as reported by the Antara News Agency, Friday (1/11/2019).
Ma'ruf also answered the question of the relationship between the prohibition of wearing veils and reducing radicalism, which so far remains a major concern of the government. Radicalism, he said, has become a commitment of all parties to deter.
"Is it ideological radicalism, or it could be separatist radicalism. I think that, indeed if left unchecked will damage the integrity of the nation, "he stressed.
Aceh refused
West Aceh Regent, Ramli MS expressed rejection related to the discourse to ban the use of veil or niqab. In particular, if the discourse of the regulation is applied to employees in local government agencies.
"The use of the veil among women is a human right (HAM) of Muslims who must be upheld by anyone, and any party. It is better to review the policy to ban the use of the veil in government agencies as conveyed by the Minister of Religion Fachrur Razi, "said Ramli in Meulaboh, Aceh, Friday (11/01/2019).
Ramli also gave advice to the Minister of Religion Fachrur. Because, he said the Ministry of Religion desperately needed communication and soliciting opinions from MUI, Islamic mass organizations such as the PBNU, Muhammadiyah, and the Tarbiyah Islamiyah Association (Perti).
"So, polemic like this can be ended and resolved wisely," said the man who also served as PCNU of West Aceh Regency.
Formulation of radical features
In order to minimize the radical notion that has been misinterpreted so far by the government and ordinary people, Ramli also dared to voice his views. This is because the central government has long stigmatized the use of veils for Muslim women and conical pants for Muslim men as a way to counter radicalism.
"That cannot be identified with radical understanding. In order that radical understanding does not hurt Muslims, the Ministry of Religion should immediately formulate or determine the characteristics or criteria of radical understanding. So that, it becomes clear and does not harm Muslims, "he said, stating that Islam was the religion of rahmatan lil 'alamin (a blessing for the universe).
